conclusion: The problem involves analyzing how shadows A, B, C, and D change in position and size when the light source moves forward above the objects.

Object A is a group of red mushrooms.
Object B is a branch or small decorative object.
Object C is a white bunny figure.
The shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on a textured surface.
When a light source moves forward (closer to the objects), the shadows' position and size change.

premise: When the light source moves forward, the angle between the light rays and the horizontal plane changes.
conclusion: All shadows will move closer to their respective objects.

premise: When the light source moves forward, the angle between the light rays and the horizontal plane changes.
conclusion: The distance between each object and its shadow will decrease.

conclusion: Shadows will become sharper and more defined.
